page.title: 15SW BASINGSTOKE: FARMING
page.content: The area is predominately given to arable farming. Of the 64 fields counted only 2 contained sheep and 1 had cattle. Crops being grown included oil-seed rape (3),beans (1), peas (1),wheat (1),with the majority of fields being planted with barley. 3 fields were sown with grass for hay- making. A seven year crop rotation is used. 1st year - Winter Barley, 2nd - Winter Rape or Beans, 3rd - Winter Wheat, 4th, 5th, 6th and 7th years - Spring Barley. Typical varieties grown include: W.Barley - Maris Otter for malting S.Barley - Triumph for malting or feed Wheat - Armada for milling Rape - Bienvenue for oil Beans - Banner for cattle feed A programme of spraying is used to kill fungi, pests and selected weeds.
